solution_line_template: If the rectangular patch of land measures {length_rectangle} feet by {width_rectangle} feet, the total length around it or its perimeter is given by {sides_multiplier} * {length_rectangle} + {sides_multiplier} * {width_rectangle} = {product_length} + {product_width} = <<{sides_multiplier}*{length_rectangle}+{sides_multiplier}*{width_rectangle}={perimeter_rectangle}>>{perimeter_rectangle}
The square patch's perimeter is double that length, so it's {perimeter_rectangle} * {double_multiplier} = <<{perimeter_rectangle}*{double_multiplier}={perimeter_square}>>{perimeter_square}

Since the square has four equal sides, one side of the square patch of land will have a length of {perimeter_square}/{sides_square} = <<{perimeter_square}/{sides_square}={side_length_square}>>{side_length_square} feet
